actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of Saturday, January 3, 2026,  the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of Saturday, January 3, 2026, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S. 320 (Sen. Padilla):
        A bill to authorize the Earthquake Hazards Reduction Act of 1977, and for other purposes.

        -- Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

        -- The committee substitute as amended agreed to by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.
 

 S.Amdt. 4148 (Sen. Scott, of FL):
        To control funding for the National Earthquake Hazards Reduction Program.

        --Amendment SA 4148 proposed by Senator Marshall for Senator Scott FL.

        --Amendment SA 4148 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.




 S. 1626 (Sen. Murkowski):
        A bill to reauthorize the National Landslide Preparedness Act, and for other purposes.

        -- Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

        -- The committee amendment as amended agreed to by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.
 

 S.Amdt. 4149 (Sen. Scott, of FL):
        To include provisions relating to funding and deficit reduction.

        --Amendment SA 4149 proposed by Senator Marshall for Senator Scott FL.

        --Amendment SA 4149 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.

PN12-1:
        Keith Bass, of Texas, to be an Assistant Secretary of Defense

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 35. Record Vote Number: 1
Under the authority of the order of today, at  6:13 p.m, the Presiding Officer (Mr. Ricketts in the chair) declared the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
